intro: Enterosora gilpiniae, commonly known as the Gilpin's enterosora, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, velvety leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along riverbanks or in dense undergrowth. Its reproductive structures are adapted for pollination by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss, Enterosora gilpiniae is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
